title: 10 best cities for singles
text:
Caption 1. Carrboro, North Carolina Pekic / Getty Images Considered one of the most progressive communities in the southeast, Carrboro, N.C., holds a high concentration of single adults who are generally more active and social than the average American. You’ll find hipsters and hippies mingling at community events. You’ll find college students from nearby University of North Carolina sitting on barstools next to retirees. A solid collection of bars and clubs offers great places to people watch and catch and eye or two. But getting involved in community activities and getting active are probably the best ways to meet someone new. Thankfully, places like the Carrboro ArtsCenter and the Parks and Recreation Department host a classes and events that help people with common interests come together. Bike and running clubs, coed sports leagues and hiking groups often provide opportunities for new relationships to blossom.

(Pekic / Getty Images) See more galleries Caption 2. Hoboken, N.J. Barry Winiker / Getty Images Singles in Hoboken, N.J., use online dating services at a rate that doubles the national average. And the city’s historic neighborhoods filled with shops, restaurants and hangouts create a great atmosphere to make authentic connections. More than half of the city’s population is single, and nearly half of all residents are between 21 and 35. In 2010, the W Hotel became the site of the biggest speed dating event in the world, hosting about 400 eligible men and women. Residents of Hoboken make more visits to art galleries, nightclubs, sing karaoke and go dancing more than most Americans.

(Barry Winiker / Getty Images) See more galleries Nearly three in 10 U.S. households have exactly one person in them. But not all cities are created equal for those looking to find someone – whether to marry or just to be single together. With this in mind, Livability.com has named the top 10 best cities for singles. These places offer high concentrations of singles, lots of ways to meet new people and plenty of options for that first, second or third date. These cities tend to have higher-than-average rates of people who go to art galleries, bars, nightclubs and pool halls. They have more residents who are likely to dance, sing karaoke and go to romance movies. For the full report, visit http://www.livability.com/top-10/culture/10-best-cities-for-singles/2015
